1. Start capturing traffic on your network's subnet using telnet or nmap.

2. Configure your router to forward all inbound traffic on ports 1024-32768 (or whatever range is available for you) to a device on your LAN that can be easily managed remotely, such as a VPN server, firewall, or other management tool.

3. Monitor your network for any unusual activity on these ports, such as unexpected traffic or attempts to connect to these ports from an IP address outside of your LAN.
